items.title: Shogun
items.summary: Epic historical drama set in 1600s Japan. Stunning production, complex political intrigue, and incredible world-building.
items.whySteven: If Japan is on your travel bucket list, this is incredible immersion. Also just a genuinely prestige TV show.

items.title: Severance
items.summary: Employees undergo a procedure to separate work and personal memories. Mystery thriller with incredible atmosphere.
items.whySteven: Best show of 2022. Perfect for fans of weird, thoughtful sci-fi like Black Mirror but with more depth.

items.title: The Bear
items.summary: A young chef returns to Chicago to run his family's sandwich shop. Intense, authentic, beautifully made.
items.whySteven: It's about food and ambition, but also family and grief. Surprisingly emotional. The food scenes are incredible.

items.title: Dune: Part Two
items.summary: Paul Atreides unites with Chani and the Fremen while seeking revenge against those who destroyed his family.
items.whySteven: The most visually stunning blockbuster in years. Denis Villeneuve at his best. Must see on the big screen.

items.title: Free Solo
items.summary: Alex Honnold attempts to climb El Capitan without ropes. Tense, beautiful, philosophical.
items.whySteven: Even if you don't care about climbing, this is about human potential and obsession. Beautifully shot.

items.title: Slow Horses
items.summary: British MI5 rejects are banished to a dead-end department. But they keep stumbling into real cases.
items.whySteven: Gary Oldman is excellent. Smart, cynical British spy thriller. Easy to binge, always entertaining.

items.title: Oppenheimer
items.summary: The story of J. Robert Oppenheimer and the creation of the atomic bomb. Nolan's most mature film.
items.whySteven: Dense, intense, incredible performances. The kind of blockbuster that respects your intelligence.

items.title: The Last of Us
items.summary: In a post-pandemic world, a hardened survivor escorts a teenage girl across America.
items.whySteven: The rare video game adaptation that works. Emotional, well-acted, surprisingly character-focused.
